intro: Pseudogynoxys oerstedii, commonly known as the Mexican false gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
